item.description:
@Shadowspkin wrote:

Use ObjectManger.java for Objects and find

	public void loadCustomSpawns(Client c) {

Once you find that you will get the idea of how to spawn objects… For Fire making I can’t help you there sorry :S

item.title: Help with Fire making (PI) server Object drop
item.dc:creator: @Darthax Darthax
item.description:
@Darthax wrote:

ok so im working on fire making for PI {project insanity} And can’t get object 2732 to drop

if (c.playerLevel[c.playerFiremaking] >= level[slot]) { if (c.getItems().playerHasItem(590) && c.getItems().playerHasItem(logs[slot])) { if (System.currentTimeMillis() - lastLight > DELAY) { c.startAnimation(733,0); c.getItems().deleteItem(logs[slot], c.getItems().getItemSlot(logs[slot]), 1); c.getPA().addSkillXP(logs[slot] * Config.FIREMAKING_EXPERIENCE, c.playerFiremaking); Objects fire = new Objects(2732,c.getX(),c.getY(), 0, -1, 10, 3); Objects fire2 = new Objects(-1,c.getX(),c.getY(), 0, -1, 10, 60); Server.objectHandler.addObject(fire); Server.objectHandler.addObject(fire2); c.sendMessage("You light the fire."); c.getPA().walkTo(-1,0); c.turnPlayerTo(c.getX() + 1, c.getY()); this.lastLight = System.currentTimeMillis(); //c.getPA().frame1(); resetAnim = true;
it seems correct it doesn’t show Any ideas?

Read full topic
